alert.note: Alert for Coke; Sterling (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 01 at 1:43PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Coke and Sterling. * WHEN...Until 345 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 142 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. With rainfall amounts of up to 2 inches possible, minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Robert Lee, Bronte, E.V. Spence Reservoir Near Paint Creek Recreation Area, Tennyson, Broome, Fort Chadbourne, The Intersection Of Highway 208 And Ranch Road 2662, The Intersection Of Highway 158 And Ranch Road 2059 and Oak Creek Reservoir. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Poverty Canyon crossing Mule Creek, Saynor crossing Mule Creek, Juniper Road crossing just east of Highway 277, Juniper crossing Juniper Creek, Ratliff crossing just east of Highway 277, Marrow Loop crossing east Kicapoo Creek, Graham Valley crossing, Walnut crossing Little Walnut Creek, Walnut crossing Walnut Creek and Fields crossing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
